mdRecord.dcterms:title: Magneto-electric machine
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bullock & Crenshaw [manufacturer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:medium: metal; wood (plant material); paper (fiber product); string (fiber product) [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The inside of the wooden lid reads "Magneto-Electric Machine For Medical Puroposes; Sold by Bullock & Crenshaw, Druggists & Chemists, N. Sixth St. 2nd door above Arch." Hook on outer left side of box. The inside of the wooden box lid has directions for use. Bullock & Crenshaw's Magneto-Electric Machine was patented Aug 1, 1854 and is numbered 1324.
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments or apparatus
